definition: drinking water/to obtain water (for daily needs)/to absorb water/draft (of ship)
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

pinyin: chi1 shui3 bu4 wang4 wa1 jing3 ren2

definition: Drinking the water of a well, one should never forget who dug it. (idiom)
pinyin: chi1 shui3 bu4 wang4 jue2 jing3 ren2

definition: lit. the mountain dweller lives off the mountain, the shore dweller lives off the sea (idiom)/fig. to make the best use of local resources/to exploit one's position to advance oneself/to find one's niche/to live off the land
pinyin: kao4 shan1 chi1 shan1 , kao4 shui3 chi1 shui3

sentences.english: And every day just to eat fruit diet doesn't bother.
sentences.chinese: 而且每天只吃水果的飲食並不費事。

definition: water intake/to obtain water (from a well etc)
dead weight/weight capacity of a vehicle
overall tonnage (of a shipping fleet or company)
